statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \cos 2 x \cdot \cos 4 x \cdot \cos 6 x \,

step.tex:
\begin{align} I &= \int \dfrac{1}{4} [ \cos 12 x + \cos 8 x + 1 + \cos 4 x ] dx \\ &= \dfrac{1}{4}\int \cos (12 x) dx + \dfrac{1}{4}\int \cos (8 x) dx \\ &+ \dfrac{1}{4} \int dx + \dfrac{1}{4} \int \cos (4 x) dx \\
&= \dfrac{\sin 12 x}{48} + \dfrac{\sin 4x}{32} + \dfrac{ x}{4} + \dfrac{\sin 8 x}{16}+ C \end{align}

\begin{align} I &= \int \dfrac{1}{4} [ \cos 12 x + \cos 8 x + 1 + \cos 4 x ] dx \\ &= \dfrac{1}{4}\int \cos (12 x) dx + \dfrac{1}{4}\int \cos (8 x) dx \\ &+ \dfrac{1}{4} \int dx + \dfrac{1}{4} \int \cos (4 x) dx \\
&= \dfrac{- \sin 12 x}{48} - \dfrac{\sin 4x}{32} - \dfrac{ x}{4} - \dfrac{\sin 8 x}{16}+ C \end{align}
step.reason: \int \cos (a x)dx = \dfrac{\sin (a x)}{a}+ C_1 \\ \text{where } C_1 \text{ is the constant of integration.}
